posts.name: Samuel Helton
posts.cooked:
Hello, i am relatively new to the language of c/++ and chief delphi and was having some difficulties when deploying specific code to our robot. Building it poses no errors, and when it is deployed, it also shows no errors. However, the driver station reports that there is no robot code, and the RioLog was only reporting:

Robot Program Starting NT: could not open persistent file ‘/home/lvuser/networktables.json’: no such file or directory NT: Listening on NT3 port 1735, NT4 port 5810

Im not sure if this is due to a specific code error, but whatever may have gone wrong doesnt show up on the error list.

Has anyone else had this problem or was there something that i did wrong?

Thank you!

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked:
So the problem isn’t necessarily NetworkTables.  Those messages get printed out any time you start robot code.  Most likely, your code is crashing during startup.  Unfortunately, unlike Java, C++ doesn’t provide much in terms of debugging information to the console from a crash (e.g. such as a stacktrace), so you will have to use a debugger to find the problem.  One thing to try would be running your code in desktop simulation to see if it also crashes there, as it’s often easier to debug and isolate issues on desktop than doing remote debugging.

If you post a link to your code we may be able to find the problem by looking at the code, but debugging it yourself is an important skill to learn.

posts.name: Allen Nuttle
posts.cooked: You can also use “WPILib: debug robot code” and then paste the error messages here.  It will also be helpful if you share your code, ideally by using GitHub.  It’s a lot to learn, but I agree that it will be helpful to get to the point where you can do this.

posts.name: Samuel Helton

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked: It looks like you have an old version of Visual Studio installed.  You need to have Visual Studio 2022 installed to compile C++ for desktop: WPILib Installation Guide — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

link_counts.title: WPILib Installation Guide — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

posts.name: Samuel Helton
posts.cooked: Edit: after some time, the problem was revealed to be something going critically wrong with commandscheduler and defaultdrivecommand. Thanks for the help though!

posts.name: system
posts.cooked: This topic was automatically closed 365 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
